image.altText: Woman sits on a chair in her home

items.synopsis: A Brisbane mum is suing the Queensland government after she allegedly suffered extreme physical and sexual abuse as a child in the state's foster care system.

title.children: Penelope says she was raped at age 10 while in foster care. She's now suing the state for almost $2 million

image.altText: A woman with glasses and red lipstick wearing a black and green jumper leans on a balcony railing.

items.synopsis: Data from CoreLogic shows rental prices have continued to climb as the market battles chronic housing shortages and rising demand for housing. But despite an increase in the rental vacancy rate, rents are expected to keep rising.

title.children: 'It's soul-destroying': Angela rents in the most affordable capital city, but one more increase will make her homeless

image.altText: A PHEV on display at a Shanghai auto exhibition in 2023

items.synopsis: The latest sales figures suggest the age of the plug-in hybrid electric vehicle that can charge from a power point and fill up at the service station appears to be drawing to an end, at least in Australia.

title.children: A decade ago, plug-in hybrids dominated EV sales. Now they only make up 6 pc. What happened?

image.altText: Paul Smith adjusts his swimming goggles in an ocean pool at sunrise.

items.synopsis: Lightning strikes in a split second. Those who survive being struck can be left with lifelong consequences, including cognitive disability, relationship breakdowns and a dark shadow over their mental health.

title.children: Paul was struck by lightning in his 20s. He was never the same again

image.altText: A soldier in protective camouflage gear ducks and holds his helmet as a mortar explodes into the sky behind him

items.synopsis: The counteroffensive is making steady gains, but Ukraine isn't taking any chances. While soldiers grind on in bloody battle, everyday civilians are preparing to defend their villages from a potential Russian advance.

title.children: While Putin was mired in personal drama, Ukraine was quietly carrying out its counteroffensive

image.altText: AFL logo

items.synopsis: The AFL is investigating the illegal distribution of explicit images of AFL players that have been shared online without their consent.

title.children: 'Appalling and disgusting act': AFLPA hits out at distribution of explicit player images

image.altText: A close up of the back of a police officer. The black vest reads: POLICE.

items.synopsis: Seven people are charged with 44 child sex offences as police target a paedophile ring spanning Central Queensland to the southern states.

title.children: Six children rescued as police dismantle paedophile ring

image.altText: A woman wearing a camel jacket and black top leans on a fence surrounded by white roses.

items.synopsis: Jacqueline Bradley has worked all her life but found herself unemployed at 61. She's applied for dozens of suitable jobs but says the constant rejection makes it difficult to keep going.

title.children: 'It can happen to anybody, it can happen swiftly': Unemployed at 61 and struggling to survive

image.altText: A man wearing a blue jumper and hat sits on a log surrounded by men holding guns.

items.synopsis: Indonesian President Joko Widodo's trip to Papua's regional capital Jayapura is officially related to a festival, but it comes as his government tries to use what it calls "cautious" negotiations to free Philip Mark Mehrtens.

title.children: Jokowi's Papua visit sparks fresh hope in NZ pilot hostage saga

image.altText: A young blonde woman smiles while sitting on the beach at sunset.

items.synopsis: A committal hearing in Townsville has heard two drivers were allegedly encouraging each other to go "faster and faster" in the lead-up to the 2021 death of aspiring police officer Jennifer Board.

title.children: 'Insane, unsafe, stupid game' was playing out at 180kph before crash that killed 22-year-old, court hears

image.altText: Jai Hindley kisses the yellow jersey on a podium at the Tour de France.

items.synopsis: For the first time since 2015 an Australian is wearing the yellow leader's jersey at the Tour de France.

title.children: For the first time since 2015, an Australian is leading the Tour de France

image.altText: A row of solar panels and wind turbines

items.synopsis: Over the next decade, renewable projects in Queensland are set to generate enough new energy to power about 6.6 million homes. But what does this mean for the communities that will host this infrastructure?

title.children: New support available to landholders as Queensland wind and solar continue exponential growth

image.altText: Fans take their seat at the SCG amid overcast conditions

items.synopsis: Fresh criticism has surfaced about major Australian stadiums' use of facial recognition for ticket-holders to some of the country's biggest events.

title.children: How a trip to the footy could end up with you being 'treated like a criminal'

image.altText: King Charless III, wearing dark robes, rests his right hand on a red and gold crown being presented to him in a cathedral.

items.synopsis: Scotland marks the coronation of King Charles and his wife Queen Camilla with a grand procession full of pageantry and a solemn church service where he is presented with Britain's oldest crown jewels.

title.children: King Charles III presented with Britain's oldest crown jewels in Scotland

image.altText: An oil tanker is seen anchored in flat, calm water.

items.synopsis: The US Navy says it intervened to prevent the Iranian navy's attempted seizure of two commercial tankers crossing international waters in the Gulf of Oman.

title.children: Iran fires shots in attempts to seize tankers in Gulf of Oman, US Navy says

image.altText: A white Tesla plugged into an electric vehicle charging station in Brisbane

items.synopsis: With more electric vehicles entering the market the number of call outs for assistance is increasing, but what hazards are there for roadside patrol crews and first responders?

title.children: Electric vehicle roadside call-outs on the rise as industry irons out response to user uptick

image.altText: A family poses for a photograph.

items.synopsis: Australia sees skilled migrants as a critical part to filling a jobs shortage but those already here are telling friends not to follow.

title.children: Skilled migrants say 50-year parent visa delays make Australia less attractive

image.altText: A young girl with dark black hair, wearing jeans and a denim jacket, sits cross legged and smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: Young murder victim Jasmeen Kaur, 21, was forced to endure an "uncommon level of cruelty" after she was abducted by her ex-partner, who buried her alive, an Adelaide court is told.

title.children: 'Absolute terror': Young woman murdered by ex-partner was stalked, abducted and buried alive

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a blue air force uniform looks grim in front of the side doors to Parliament House.

items.synopsis: Russian cybercriminals claimed to have posted more than 1 terabyte of stolen data on the dark web in June. The firm's clients include the big four banks and the federal health department.

title.children: Massive law firm hack affected government departments, Australia's new cyber security coordinator confirms

image.altText: A protester is challenged by security on tennis court.

items.synopsis: Australia's Daria Saville sees her Wimbledon first-round match interrupted by protesters who invade Court 18 before being arrested by London police, with the UK home secretary promising harsh punishments.

title.children: Dark day for Australians as climate protesters arrested at Wimbledon

image.altText: A squat, grey and reddish-brown building with a white number 4 on it sits against a grey-blue sky.

items.synopsis: The nuclear plant, which was seized by Russian troops in February 2022, has long been the subject of suspicions between the two sides, and any attack on the facility — Europe's largest, with six reactors — could have catastrophic consequences.

title.children: Tensions high around Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant as Ukraine and Russia allege 'catastrophic' sabotage

image.altText: A crowd of men and women stand looking serious, Littleproud and Price at the fore.

items.synopsis: Senior members of the Nationals are locking in behind David Littleproud amid leadership chatter, adding they're "not worried at all".

title.children: 'Absolute nonsense': Nationals rule out leadership challenge amid tensions over climate policy

image.altText: The NRL logo on a building with clouds above it

items.synopsis: Players will boycott game-day media commitments, including during State of Origin III, as part of an ongoing CBA dispute between the NRL and the RLPA.

title.children: Players insist NRL media blackout 'not about turning backs on fans'

image.altText: A middle-distance photo of a middle-aged man in a blue and white Wallabies T-shirt and cap smiling on a training field.

items.synopsis: Jones has achieved enormous success, but there's one thing he hasn't done: claim a World Cup victory as a coach. He's hoping his second stint with the Wallabies will change that.

title.children: Eddie Jones is looking for one final shot at World Cup glory, and he wants to take the Australian public along for the ride

image.altText: Three aboriginal elders

items.synopsis: First Nations elders around the country are being celebrated for NAIDOC week, but what makes an elder? We follow three Indigenous leaders in regional NSW as they do something they love in their communities.

title.children: These three Indigenous elders are on a mission to pass on culture and knowledge to the next generation

image.altText: BRS

items.synopsis: Legal invoices issued to Seven Network and Kerry Stokes's private company are among documents Nine Entertainment has won access to in the Federal Court.

title.children: Nine secures minor win in bid to recover legal costs from Ben Roberts-Smith's backers

image.altText: A small boat upturned in dark blue ocean.

items.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority was alerted to the emergency this morning. The survivors are reportedly suffering from mild hypothermia.

title.children: Four people rescued 17 hours after boat capsizes off WA coast

image.altText: Generic police image (file photo).

items.synopsis: The woman is accused of the indecent treatment of a child under 16. The offences are alleged to have occurred between June 2015 and July 2016.

title.children: Woman facing nearly 80 charges over alleged abuse of Gold Coast teenager

image.altText: A smiling woman stands next to a man, whose face is blurred, in front of a glass door

items.synopsis: Raelene Polymiadis — who is accused of administering her parents with lethal doses of medication a year apart — appears in the Adelaide Magistrates Court and is denied bail.

title.children: Daughter accused of murdering her parents allegedly administered lethal doses of medication, court hears

image.altText: People are picking up items of furniture covered in mud on a driveway.

items.synopsis: Torrential rain devastates the Chinese city of Chongqing, as President Xi Jinping calls for greater efforts to protect the public from extreme weather.

title.children: Flooding kills 15 in south-west China as Xi urges better defences

image.altText: A smiling woman with white hair.

items.synopsis: NSW Police Senior Constable Kristian White appears in court via video link charged with tasering 95-year-old dementia patient Clare Nowland, who died days later.

title.children: Magistrate 'disgusted' with prosecutors as police officer charged with tasering 95yo faces court via video link

image.altText: woman in gym gear walks in glaring sun along Brisbane River

items.synopsis: Scientists warned us it was close — and now we have data suggesting Tuesday, July 4, 2023, broke the record for the average daily global temperature.

title.children: The world just had its hottest day on record, data shows — and experts say it's only going to get hotter
